Posts.Content: Downtowngirl33 wrote: I had a biopsy a year ago (benign). This year they biposied 3 different areas. One is papillary apocrine metaplasia, another focal columnar cell change and the last one is PASH. Plus I have dense breast tissue. I will see the breast specialist in a few days... I am thinking she will either say lets wait and see, or have lumpectomies, or remove all of the tissue. Anyone else have a similar experience/advice? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 3 biopsies resulting in PAM, CCL and PASH Downtowngirl33 marie5890

Posts.Content: Downtowngirl33 wrote: Hello Ladies. I had my most recent mammogram on day 9 of my menstrual cycle and there were 10 or 11 cysts on 1 breast alone. I am going to have a MRI soon and am trying to pinpoint the best time to have it done. Usually there about 27 or so days in my cycle but this time it was only 20 days. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: When to have a MRI Downtowngirl33 Downtowngirl33
